title: A Report  'Review of Communications In Crisis Situations'

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: A Report  'Review of Communications In Crisis Situations'
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The report of the study by Asst. Sec. Def. Solis Horwitz "Memorandum for the Deputy Secretary of Defense from Assistant Secretary of Defense (Administration), subject: 'Review of Communications In Crisis Situations,' November 10, 1967."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: milwaukee 14 DOJ
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records concerning the Milwaukee Fourteen who were arrested in 1968 for burning draft records. According to the National Archives, these documents might still reside with the Department of Justice. I am interested in the following case files referring to both individual people and the incident in question as well as any other request retained by the DoJ. 

-Case files: 100A-BA-25222 and 100-MW-1581
-case files 146-1-62-564 through 146-1-62-3693 on Donald Joseph Cotton 
-case file 146-1-85-817 on Michael Deans Cullen 
-case file 146-1-85-816 on John Hurbert Higgenbotham 
-case file 146-1-39-1097 on Douglas Ian Marvy 
-case file 146-1-39-1094 on Frederick John Ojile
-case file 25-85-473

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Guariglia
